poem:
Title: "Contours of the Digital Dawn"

The hands of youth dance on frosted keys,
oblivious to life's quieter symphonies,
where synapses echo in the realm of screens,
a realm that unfurls, yet never truly seen.
In the hush, a humming brain network spins,
trapped by pixels, by binary sins.
Yet, could the young heart's innate song,
outlast the siren's thrumming throng?
